Title.evidence: Balancing of the joint gap in extension and flexion is a prerequisite for success of a total knee arthroplasty.

Objective.evidence: We therefore hypothesized the state of the knee extensor mechanism (including the patellar tendon) would influence the joint gap.

Method_Outcome.evidence: we measured the joint gap and the patellar tendon strain from 0° to 135° flexion with the femoral component in position.

Result_Outcome.evidence: When the patella was reduced, the joint gap was decreased at 90° and 135° (by 1.9 mm and 5.5 mm, respectively) compared with the gap with the patella everted.
